title: Record-setting day of postseason homers
text:
Updated: 11:24 p.m. Monday, Oct. 12, 2015 | Posted: 11:24 p.m. Monday, Oct. 12, 2015 Record-setting day of postseason homers Related Chicago Cubs center fielder Dexter Fowler (24) hits a home run against the St. Louis Cardinals during the eighth inning of Game 3 in baseball's National League Division Series, Monday, Oct. 12, 2015, in Chicago. (AP Photo/Charles Rex Arbogast) Sponsored Links The Associated Press 
From Carlos Correa to Adrian Gonzalez, baseball's sluggers are having quite a day. 
There have been 20 home runs Monday, a record for one day in postseason play. The latest was a solo shot by Gonzalez in the seventh inning for the Los Angeles Dodgers in their NL Division Series game against the New York Mets. 
Correa hit two of Houston's four homers against Kansas City, and the Chicago Cubs hit a postseason-record six home runs in their victory over St. Louis. Three of Toronto's first eight batters homered in an ALDS win at Texas. 
The previous postseason record was 15 home runs on Oct. 3, 1995, according to STATS. Like Monday, there were four postseason games on that day 20 years ago. Copyright The Associated Press Sign up for our WFTV Morning News Headlines Newsletter Sign Up
